definition-item.definition-title: CHEMICAL OR PHYSICAL LABORATORY APPARATUS FOR GENERAL USE

list-item.paragraph-text: Apparatus for medical or pharmaceutical purposes — A61

Apparatus for industrial purposes or laboratory apparatus whose construction and performance are comparable to that of similar industrial apparatus. See the relevant classes for industrial apparatus, particularly subclasses of classes B01 or C12.
Apparatus for enzymology or microbiology — C12M
Microorganisms or enzymes; Compositions thereof; Propagating, preserving or maintaining microorganisms; Mutation or genetic engineering; Culture media —C12N

Measuring or testing processes involving enzymes, nucleic acids or microorganisms; Compositions or test papers therefor; Processes of preparing such compositions; Condition-responsive control in microbiological or enzymological processes — C12Q
Apparatus specially adapted for investigating or analysing materials — G01, particularly G01N
Electrical or optical apparatus — see the relevant classes in sections G and H

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Microorganisms or enzymes; Compositions thereof; Propagating, preserving or maintaining microorganisms; Mutation or genetic engineering; Culture media

Measuring or testing processes involving enzymes, nucleic acids or microorganisms; Compositions or test papers therefor; Processes of preparing such compositions; Condition-responsive control in microbiological or enzymological processes
Apparatus specially adapted for investigating or analysing materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for medical or pharmaceutical purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Classification Rules:

Groups B01L1/00 – B01L99/00 are given for invention information, i.e. the information is such that, if you do a search on this subject-matter, it is important to see the document. The definitions below give guidance as to scope and limits of the respective groups. Additional information is classified with Indexing symbols in the range B01L1/00 – B01L99/00. These symbols are used with or without a group in B01L. In addition to a group in B01L, indexing symbols in the range B01L2200/00 – B01L2400/00 are applied where possible to all documents classified in B01L. Indexing symbols B01L2200/00 – B01L2400/00 are not used for documents without a group in B01L. Also, if documents have only an indexing symbol in the range B01L1/00 – B01L99/00, no Indexing symbol is used.
Double classification:

Often double classification will be necessary, also within B01L itself. For example, in documents relating to sample containers it might be that a document is classified for sample taking in A61B10/0045, for sample storage, in B01L3/50, and for a specific analysis technique, in G01N.

definition-item.definition-title: Enclosures; Chambers (provided with manipulation devices or glove boxes B25J21/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Chambers, enclosures, rooms and cupboards for laboratory use which have no specific application.
Air-pressure chambers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chambers provided with manipulation devices, glove boxes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Air-pressure chambers; Air-locks therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Incubator or conditioning cabinet not otherwise provided for. Doors and bayonet designs.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Environmental chambers (incubators for culturing cells C12M41/14; test chambers to test weather resistance G01N17/002)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Closed chambers, not otherwise provided for, to provide a defined environment such as temperature, pressure, humidity and other gas concentrations, climate chambers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Test chambers to test weather resistance

definition-item.definition-title: Dust-free rooms or enclosures

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for storing hazardous materials in the laboratory, e.g. cupboards, waste containers (sample containers B01L3/50)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Enclosures or chambers for storing hazardous materials in the laboratory.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Containers or dishes for laboratory use, e.g. laboratory glassware; Droppers

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Simple fluid transfer means, such as tubes, valves or fittings.
Various containers, in particular for sample or reagent storage also comprising microfluidic structures.
Droppers comprising various fluid dispensing means such as pipettes, burettes and droplet dispensers.
Spatulas.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Due to the diversity of the subgroups in this group the head group is only rarely used to classify. It is preferred to use all relevant main groups instead.

definition-item.definition-title: Burettes; Pipettes

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Burettes, pipettes, pipette tips, droplet counters, droplet dispensers (droppers), and other laboratory devices to withdraw and discharge a liquid.
This class relates to generally to manually operated devices, but is not restricted to hand held devices. Automation of pipetting stations is classified in G01N35/10.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Repeated volume dosing of fluids in general
Dispensing of fluids in automatic analysers

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means to dispense the liquid dropwise

definition-item.definition-title: {Burettes, i.e. for withdrawing and redistributing liquids through different conduits}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Burettes, i.e. for withdrawing and redistributing liquids through different conduits.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: If the volume dispensed is droplet sized

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Pipettes, i.e. with only one conduit for withdrawing and redistributing liquids}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pipettes, i.e. with only one conduit for withdrawing and redistributing liquids.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: If the volume dispensed is droplet sized

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pipette type sampler or inoculator for cell handling

section-body.paragraph-text: If used to fill standard multiwell plates use B01L2300/0829.

definition-item.definition-title: {Accessories for glass pipettes; Gun-type pipettes, e.g. safety devices, pumps}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This group covers accesories for (traditional) glass pipettes, such as safety devices to protect the user from inhaling hazardous fluids or pumps. This group also encompasses gun-type pipettors.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {of the plunger pump type (medical syringes A61M)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Piston or plunger-type pipettes.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fluid dosing with measuring chambers in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Capillary pipettes, i.e. having very small bore (B01L3/0224 - B01L3/0237 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pipettes where a piston or plunger is moved within a capillary.
Pipettes having a capillary needle but no plunger within the capillary are not classified here, use Indexing Code B01L2300/0838 in combination with appropriate group in B01L3/02 instead.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pippetes having mechanical means to set stroke length
Details of electronic control, e.g. relating to user interface

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {having several coaxial pistons}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Plunger pipettes with coaxial pistons. This group does NOT cover multiple parallel plungers.

definition-item.definition-title: {Repeating pipettes, i.e. for dispensing multiple doses from a single charge}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Drop counters; Drop formers (making arrays for combinatorial libraries B01J19/0046; automation of dispensing for analysis G01N35/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Droplet dispensers and droplet counters. This group covers the constructional details of the dispensing part itself not the automation aspects.
The integration into automated systems is classified for instance in G01N35/10 and B01J19/0046
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means for dispensing and evacuation of reagents to make chemical libraries

section-body.paragraph-text: If used to fill standard multiwell plates use B01L2300/0829.

definition-item.definition-title: {using pins}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Droplet dispensers using pins.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nibs, quills, pens for writing and drawing

section-body.paragraph-text: Use B01L2400/02 for details of printing action.

definition-item.definition-title: {using stamps}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {using touch-off at substrate or container}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

In touch-off dispensers the liquid contacts the target surface while it still hangs at the dispenser thus leading to a bridge between the two bodies. Capillary forces draw the liquid subsequently, at least in part, to the target surface.

definition-item.definition-title: {using pulse dispensing or spraying, eg. inkjet type, piezo actuated ejection of droplets from capillaries}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nozzles and apparatus for spraying or atomising in general

definition-item.definition-title: {Dropper bottles}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Interchangeable or disposable dispensing tips}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pipette tips, note that the subgroup also covers ejection means for pipette tips.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: "chip (in English translations of Japanese documents)" and " (pipette) tips"

definition-item.definition-title: {co-operating with positive ejection means}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pipette tip ejectors.
Note that this is not restricted to the features of the tip itself but can also relate to the ejection mechanism of the pipette.

definition-item.definition-title: {mounted within a receptacle (wash bottles B01L3/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Apparatus for withdrawing or distributing predetermined quantities of fluid (B01L3/02 takes precedence; sample taking G01N1/00; sample taking within automatic analysers G01N35/00; volume measuring in general G01F)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fluid handling apparatus not provided for in B01L3/02, this group is restricted to gas, beads or pulverized materials.
The subgroup is used as residual group for liquid handling.

definition-item.definition-title: {for liquids}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Liquid handling apparatus not provided for in B01L3/02.

definition-item.definition-title: Crystallising dishes

section-body.paragraph-text: Often used in combination with classes in B01L3/50.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
If used as a sample container double classify with relevant class in B01L3/50

definition-item.definition-title: Flasks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Flasks used in the lab and not otherwise provided for. Flasks usually comprise an inlet which is smaller than the main body.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

definition-item.definition-title: Gas jars or cylinders

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Retorts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Retorts are simple distillation apparatuses. They often comprise round bases and turned down necks.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Containers for the purpose of retaining a material to be analysed, e.g. test tubes (devices for taking samples of blood A61B5/15)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Simple containers that only store the sample and also more complex containers with integrated passive or active parts, which inter alia transport samples within them.
Containers for chemical synthesis, even if of small size, are classified in B01J.

Containers specific to a single analytical technique are usually classified in the respective field, e.g. in G01N, C12M. Documents are double classified in both places when, due to their constructional aspects, they are also relevant for other applications.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for taking samples of blood

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for preservation of excised living parts of the human or animal body
Constructional details of bioreactors for culturing

section-body.paragraph-text: It is important to note that this group is restricted to sample containers and not to lab containers in general.

definition-item.definition-title: {with fluid transport, e.g. in multi-compartment structures (centrifugal-type cuvettes G01N21/07; analysis by separation into components G01N30/00; automatic analysers G01N35/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample container where fluid is transported during use between different parts of the container.
In addition to storage of the sample these containers usually enable other function as well, such as sample preparation or analysis. Double classification is preferred.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Measuring characteristics of blood in vivo and taking blood samples
Taking bodily sample other than blood
Devices for introducing media into the body

definition-item.definition-title: {Test tubes specially adapted for centrifugation purposes (centrifuges B04B5/04)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Non-tubular centrifugal sample containers are classified in B01L3/502.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with a sample being transported to, and subsequently stored in an absorbent for analysis}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Constructional details and flow shaping in sample containers where liquid is transported through an absorbent, e.g. lateral flow devices.
Analysis technique, sensor details and chemistry of lateral flow devices are classified in G01N, e.g. G01N33/543.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Double classify with B01L3/5027 or B01L3/5027 for porous microchannels in a substrate.

definition-item.definition-title: {for parallel transport of multiple samples}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Multi-well filtration}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {by integrated microfluidic structures, i.e. dimensions of channels and chambers are such that surface tension forces are important, e.g. lab-on-a-chip (B01L3/5023 takes precedence; micromixers B01F33/30; microreactors for synthesis B01J19/0093; microcapillary devices in general B81B1/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers with integrated microfluidic components. Microfluidic components are not restricted to capillary transport but are defined by their small size.

Microfluidic devices can be found in a number of different fields. This group covers only those devices that are used to analyse a sample. The focus is on the sample handling per se in such devices, i.e. handling of fluids, beads, single molecules. The specifics of the analysis itself is for example classified in G01N and C12Q.
Capillary fluid transport in porous materials as flow layers of sample containers, e.g. lateral flow devices, are classified in B01L3/5023.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
For microfluidic devices characterized by the specific integrated thermal control, e.g. for PCR, use double classification with B01L7/00.
Use index codes B01L2200/00-B01L2400/00 as complete as possible.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

list-item.paragraph-text: " sample containers with integrated microfluidic components", "lab-on-a-chip" and "microfluidic device for analysis"

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the manufacture of the container or its components (by shaping or joining plastic parts B29C59/00, B29C65/00; by laminating B32B37/00; manufacture of microstructural devices in general B81C)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers with integrated microfluidic components with specific manufacturing details.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture of microstructural devices in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by interfacing components, e.g. fluidic, electrical, optical or mechanical interfaces}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Integrated microfluidic interfaces, i.e. the section of the interface which forms part of the container.
Fluidic interfaces comprise inlets and outlets.
Optical interfaces may comprise lenses, prisms, mirrors.
Mechanical interfaces may comprise aligning marks, guides.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling and feeding of cartridges in automated analysers

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by venting arrangements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means to remove air or gases from a microfluidic sample container.
Also comprises documents where bubble formation is avoided.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Venting, avoiding backpressure, avoid gas bubbles

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the means or forces applied to move the fluids (micropumps F04B19/006, of the membrane type F04B43/043)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means or forces to move fluid in microfluidic sample containers, e.g. integrated pumps.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Influencing the flow rate for a given force
Micropumps of the membrane type in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Use Indexing Codes B01L2400/04 to specify the kind of force or means to move the fluid.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by integrated valves (microvalves F16K99/0001)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

This group covers the constructional details of valves specific to microfluidic sample containers. It also covers valving schemes when they depend on integrated structures, like cascades of capillary valves.
External valve actuators are classified in F16K or G01N35/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Throttle valves in microfluidic sample containers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
For valve details use B01L2400/06.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means to stop or divert the whole flow of a fluid

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the means for controlling flow resistance, e.g. flow controllers, baffles (B01L3/502738 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Controlling the flow resistance in a microfluidic sample container which is neither valving, where the flow is stopped, nor pumping, which is the source of the force for the flow.
For example, providing baffles in order to slow but not stop a flow in a specific section of a channel. Adapting the channel dimensions to obtain a specific flow pattern.
This place does not cover:
For flow control details use B01L2400/08.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by bulk separation arrangements on lab-on-a-chip devices, e.g. for filtration or centrifugation (separation in general B01D; microapparatus for analysis using electrophoresis G01N27/44791; sample preparation G01N1/28)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sample containers with integrated microfluidic components with bulk separation such as filtration or centrifugation. In general, the flow direction of the bulk fluid is the same as the component which is separated. In a bulk separation a certain class of particles/fluid is usually separated from another class as a group. For example, centrifugation leads to a classification of particle groups based on their densitiy.
When the separation is the only purpose and the device is not combined with sample storage, i.e. not integrated, it should not be classified in this group.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separation or sorting of particles or molecules on an individual level

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separation of solids from solids or fluids by e.g.electric or magnetic means, dielectrophoresis
Analysing blood by separating its components

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted for handling suspended solids or molecules independently from the bulk fluid flow, e.g. for trapping or sorting beads, for physically stretching molecules (investigating characteristics of particles G01N15/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Handling of suspended solids or molecules independent from the bulk fluid flow. In general, the fluid flow direction of the bulk fluid is different from the flow direction of the component to be separated. Handling may comprise trapping, sorting, stretching, orientating of particles or molecules.

Usually particles or molecules are handled individually, thus they can be selectively handled irrespective of whether more particles or molecules of the same type/class exist in the sample. For example, a single DNA molecule may be stretched in a nanochannel although the sample comprises many more DNA molecules.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separation of solids from solids or fluids by e.g.electric or magnetic means, dielectrophoresis
Separating or Sorting solids from solids

section-body.paragraph-text: When particles/molecules are separated as part of a whole class (as bulk) they are classified in B01L3/502753.
Details of particle/molecule handling can be coded in B01L2200/0647.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by multiphase flow arrangements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sample containers with integrated microfluidic components having multiphase flow arrangements. Multiphase flow is meant to encompass flows where gas/liquid or liquid/liquid interfaces exist and kept during flow of the fluids. The fluids may be immiscible but under certain conditions this may not be necessary.
This group is only used in the rare event that none of the groups below are suitable.

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted for focusing or laminating flows}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers with integrated microfluidic components having laminated flow arrangements, such as a sheath flow.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted for droplet or plug flow, e.g. digital microfluidics (automatic analysis using a stream of discrete samples in a tube system G01N35/08)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Droplets or plug flow in sample containers with integrated microfluidic components, such as digital microfluidics.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Automatic analysis using a stream of discrete samples in a tube system (bench top sized)

definition-item.definition-title: {for moving individual droplets on a plate, e.g. by locally altering surface tension}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Moving droplets individually on a plate, for example by electrowetting.
The droplet may also be bordered by a cover plate in addition to a bottom plate. No side walls are present to guide the droplet.
If present, use Indexing Code for virtual walls B01L2300/089

definition-item.definition-title: {using swabs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers comprising both fluid transport and swabs. The invention is usually directed to the handling of the swab within the container and not the swab itself.
Swabs as sample taking devices are found in G01N1/02 and A61B10/0045.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cell sampling container with a swab

definition-item.definition-title: {flexible containers not provided for above}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Flexible sample containers such as bags or foldable sample cards.

definition-item.definition-title: {Hinged, e.g. opposable surfaces}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Folded sample cards.

definition-item.definition-title: {rigid containers not provided for above}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers having rigid walls and which do not comprise any internal sample transport.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rigid sample containers with fluid transport

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Vacuum locks for discharge tubes (and sample vessels to be used in vacuum)

definition-item.definition-title: {Test tubes per se}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers having the form of tubes, also covers centrifugal type test tubes and test tube caps.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sample containers with other geometrical forms
Test tubes with sample transport other than by centrifugation
Racks and holders for test tubes
Devices for taking samples of blood

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tubular or bottle type culture devices

definition-item.definition-title: {Closing or opening means, corks, bungs (closures for containers B65D; means for removing stoppers B67B7/02)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Test tube caps having additional chambers, e.g. for reagents, are also classified in B01L3/502.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
For details use B01L2300/04.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {for multiple samples, e.g. microtitration plates}

section-body.paragraph-text: Microarray sensors such as DNA-chips without any sample storage are classified elsewhere, e.g. in B01J19/0046 or G01N33/50.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes and Apparatus for making combinatorial libraries

section-body.paragraph-text: Use B01L2300/0829 for standard microtiter plate format.

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted for heating or cooling samples (laboratory heating apparatus B01L7/00; incubators C12M)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sample containers for thermal treatment of samples, such as PCR containers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {with covers or lids}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Constructional details of closures for multisample containers.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling of closures in automated systems

section-body.paragraph-text: For details use Indexing Codes B01L2300/04.

definition-item.definition-title: {using modular assemblies of strips or of individual wells}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multisample containers which can be assembled and/or disassembled during use but which form a single unit when they are assembled. These are typically assembled into a standard format using a frame.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Holders and racks for test tubes

definition-item.definition-title: {using arrays or bundles of open capillaries for holding samples}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multiple parallel capillaries which hold a sample by surface tension at a specific location. The sample is not transported within the device except for filling or draining.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Parallel capillaries as sample containers involving transport within said capillaries

definition-item.definition-title: {confining liquids at a location by surface tension, e.g. virtual wells on plates, wires (B01L3/50857 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Droplet is also moved, transported on the substrate

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Applying liquids to render a surface hydrophobic

section-body.paragraph-text: For multiple samples double classify with B01L3/5085.

definition-item.definition-title: {Containers specially adapted for storing or dispensing a reagent (B01L3/02 takes precedence; containers for medical or pharmaceutical purposes A61J1/00; containers in general B65D; storing or dispensing test elements G01N33/4875; automated reagent dispensing G01N35/1002)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reagent containers.

Sample containers with integrated reagent containers are not classified in this group. However, if the reagent container is a (modular) unit which can be inserted into a sample container and is thus not an integral part of the sample container it should be classified in this group.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Sample containers having additional integrated compartments for reagents are not classfied in this group but in B01L3/50 use mirror Indexing Codes B01L3/52 instead or B01L2200/16.

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for closing or opening}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for a plurality of reagents}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Labware with identification means (identification of carriers, materials or components in automatic analysers G01N35/00732)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Labels, barcodes, RFIDs and other identification means used for labware.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Record carrier designed to carry digital markings like barcodes, RFID

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for laboratory containers}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: ICT specially adapted for the handling or processing of patient-related medical or healthcare data related to laboratory analysis

definition-item.definition-title: {Labware specially adapted for transferring fluids}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Simple labware to transfer fluids, in particular traditional glassware and its accessories, such as connectors, valves, tubes, funnels.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Medical tubes, connectors, couplings, valves and the like

definition-item.definition-title: {Tubes; Conduits (in general F16L)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Joints or fittings (in general F16L); Separable fluid transfer means to transfer fluids between at least two containers, e.g. connectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: If connectors are integrated into a sample container use

definition-item.definition-title: {connecting two containers face to face, e.g. comprising a filter}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Direct connection between only two containers.

definition-item.definition-title: {Seals (in general F16L)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Valves, taps or stop-cocks (in combination with burettes B01L3/0203; in general F16K)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Valves specifically used in connection with laboratory equipment.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Automated sample transfer characterised by valves

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Glassware}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Residual group for glassware not falling in any of the above groups, i.e. must by made of glass.

definition-item.definition-title: Gas handling apparatus (gas jars or cylinders B01L3/12; cold traps or cold baffles B01D8/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Gas collection apparatus, e.g. by bubbling under water (for sampling G01N1/22)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Heating or cooling apparatus (autoclaves B01J3/04); Heat insulating devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thermostats for heating or cooling and heat insulation devices.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drying gases or vapours, e.g. desiccators

section-body.paragraph-text: To specify the thermostating means, indexing symbol B01L2300/18 and subgroups are used.

definition-item.definition-title: Water baths; Sand baths; Air baths

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Heat insulating devices, e.g. jackets for flasks

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Stand alone heat insulation device.

definition-item.definition-title: {Cryostats}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Temperature processes for preservation of excised living parts of the human or animal body

definition-item.definition-title: {with provision for submitting samples to a predetermined sequence of different temperatures, e.g. for treating nucleic acid samples (amplification or hybridisation processes per se C12Q1/68; controlling sequential reactions for synthesis B01J19/0046)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thermocyclers and other thermostats where a sample is exposed to a defined sequence of different temperatures. For example used for PCR.
The specific analysis methods of polymerase chain reactions (PCR) are classified in C12Q1/68.
Other integrated means such as specific detectors, or means for automation are classified in G01N.
This place does not cover:
Use double classification with microfluidic sample containers of B01L3/5027.

definition-item.definition-title: {using spatial temperature gradients}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Thermostats creating a defined temperature gradient in space.

definition-item.definition-title: Supporting devices; Holding devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Holding frame constructions, trays for drying labware or holders for labware not provided for in a subgroup.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Laboratory benches or tables; Fittings therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Test-tube stands; Test-tube holders

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Automated analysers with conveyors for sample containers

definition-item.definition-title: {Clamping means, tongs (in general F16B2/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Indicating positions of wells and other receptacles by numbers, characters, grooves or other means.

definition-item.definition-title: {Supports specially adapted for flat sample carriers, e.g. for plates, slides, chips}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Supports specially adapted for flat sample carriers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Supports specially adapted for pipettes and burettes (automated pipetting stations G01N35/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Supports specially adapted for pipettes and burettes.
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Positioning tool for sampling or inoculating
